terms.definition: Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a service provider and accessed via the internet
A centralized repository of information, documentation, and resources that provides answers to common questions and solutions to problems
The systematic process of creating, organizing, storing, and maintaining documents to ensure they are accessible, current, and compliant with standards
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, ensuring only the most current versions are used while maintaining historical records
A single, unified storage location where all documents and files are kept, making them easily accessible to authorized users from one place
A software system that runs on remote servers accessed via the internet rather than on local computers or servers
The coordination and automation of business processes, including document review, approval, and routing between team members
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously, seeing changes as they happen instantly
The systematic monitoring and recording of adherence to regulatory requirements, standards, and internal policies
A systematic examination and verification of documents, procedures, and records to ensure compliance with regulations and standards
Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points - a systematic preventive approach to food safety that identifies physical, chemical, and biological hazards
terms.expanded: Hazard Analysis and Critical Control Points

terms.definition: Food Safety Modernization Act - U.S. legislation that focuses on preventing foodborne illness rather than responding to contamination after it occurs
The process of storing older or outdated documents in a systematic way for future reference while removing them from active use
The collaborative management of processes and information sharing between different departments or teams within an organization
The use of technology to perform tasks automatically without human intervention, such as document updates, notifications, and reminders
